review: I ordered the Fire TV without reading any of the reviews.  Then, before it arrived, I started reading reviews and got a bit scared that I had made a mistake.  After playing with the gadget for several hours yesterday, I'm happy that I bought it.First, let me say that I bought the Fire TV to replace an older Roku that did not do HD.  I was also looking forward to the voice search feature. Netflix is my primary programming provider, so discovering that voice search only worked on Amazon content was the one negative.  It mentions this on the box, but I could find no mention of it in the web ad.  The only other thing that bothers me slightly is that the Roku has a LOT more apps for content providers.  Things like NASA, AOPA, and other special interests.  Maybe in time they will make it to fire.My positives are mostly that I did not encounter problems that many others claim to have had.  Setup was fast and easy.  The device found my remote and connected to my wifi with no problem.  I read a couple reviews complaining of poor wifi range.  I ran into evidence of the opposite.  The Fire TV device found several of my neighbors networks that were not discovered by the Roku or several other wifi devices I own.  I would call its wifi capability superior.The software update took just under ten minutes and no problems were encountered.  I watched two movies and did not have any pauses for buffering. My internet connection is a bit slow, so I thought I would run into the buffering issue that some mentioned. The remote works well. Navigation is simple.  I did not run into any problems with the Netflix app.  I read some complaints about it being "broken" but did not find evidence of this.
author: Robert Mason

review: I recently ordered and installed the Fire TV. It was easy to set up and get started. The performance is amazing. I have had apple tv and Roku and this is my favorite by a long shot. There has been no "buffer" lag and the voice recognition is right on target. I have recommended this product to my family and friends. This just may be the device to make be cut the cable!
